intro: Hordeum jubatum var. comosum, commonly known as the silky barley or silky grass, is a perennial grass species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 (clumped) growth habit and fine, silky hairs on its leaves and stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, wetlands, and along stream banks. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
